name: Read.ai Free
summary_and_recommendation: Read.ai Free presents medium risk primarily due to limited enterprise controls in the free tier and automatic meeting attendance capabilities. While the vendor demonstrates good transparency with SOC 2 Type 2 certification and opt-out-by-default training policies, the free version lacks comprehensive admin controls and audit capabilities. The tool's automatic meeting joining feature raises privacy concerns for sensitive discussions. Recommendation: Requires review and implementation of usage policies before deployment. Consider upgrade to Enterprise+ plan for sensitive use cases.

geographic.note: External servers with unclear specific geographic location. Documentation mentions encryption and SOC 2 compliance but does not specify data residency requirements or geographic controls for the free tier.

encryption.note: Enterprise-grade encryption documented with SOC 2 Type 2 certification mentioning appropriate encryption algorithms. Every measured meeting is encrypted with permissions on who can access reports, indicating strong encryption practices.

retention.note: Clear limited retention with user-controlled deletion capabilities. Documentation states users can delete audio, video, data, reports, and even entire accounts with immediate effect. Post-call settings allow granular deletion control.

training.note: Opt-out available with clear process. Documentation explicitly states 'Contributing to our model is completely optional, and opt-out by default.' This indicates no training use unless users actively opt-in, which significantly reduces risk.

sharing.note: No third-party sharing. Documentation explicitly states 'we don't sell your data to anyone - period' and 'Your data is kept private and only used to provide the service to you.' No indication of third-party data sharing.

admin.note: Limited controls for free tier. While Enterprise+ plan offers additional security features, the free version appears to have minimal organizational visibility and centralized management capabilities. Individual account-based with limited admin oversight.

audit.note: Basic auditing capabilities. Users can see who invited Read to meetings and have access to meeting reports with permission controls, but comprehensive audit logs and exportable reports are not clearly documented for the free tier.

integration.note: Limited integration available. Supports SSO login (Microsoft, Google) and calendar integration, but lacks comprehensive enterprise identity management features like SCIM provisioning and advanced API access for the free tier.

violations.note: Mostly compliant with published SOC 2 Type 2 certification and HIPAA compliance capabilities. Documentation mentions ability to provide Business Associates Agreement for HIPAA compliance, indicating strong regulatory compliance foundation.

transparency.note: Opaque processing for some aspects. While general data processing is described and retention policies are clear, specific data flow diagrams and detailed third-party processor lists are not publicly available, requiring contact with support for detailed audit reports.

score.note: Adequate documentation with clear privacy policy and basic security information. SOC 2 Type 2 certification available upon request through support. Responsive support email provided but response times not specified. Some security details require contacting support rather than being publicly available.

recommended_restrictions: Require explicit approval for each meeting

recommendations.title: Implement Meeting Classification
recommendations.description: Establish clear policies for which meeting types Read.ai is permitted to join, with explicit blocking for confidential, legal, or sensitive business discussions

recommendations.title: User Training Program
recommendations.description: Conduct comprehensive training on Read.ai's opt-out mechanisms and data handling practices, ensuring users understand how to remove the bot from sensitive meetings

recommendations.title: Consider Enterprise Upgrade
recommendations.description: For organizations handling sensitive data, evaluate Read.ai's Enterprise+ plan which offers additional security features and administrative controls

recommendations.title: Regular Access Review
recommendations.description: Implement quarterly reviews of which users have Read.ai access and establish procedures for immediate revocation when needed

detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: Read.ai Free presents medium risk primarily due to limited enterprise controls in the free tier and automatic meeting attendance capabilities. While the vendor demonstrates good transparency with SOC 2 Type 2 certification and opt-out-by-default training policies, the free version lacks comprehensive admin controls and audit capabilities. The tool's automatic meeting joining feature raises privacy concerns for sensitive discussions. Recommendation: Requires review and implementation of usage policies before deployment. Consider upgrade to Enterprise+ plan for sensitive use cases.

geographic_control.justification: External servers with unclear specific geographic location. While Read.ai maintains SOC 2 Type 2 certification indicating professional infrastructure management, the specific geographic location of data storage is not clearly documented in publicly available materials. This creates uncertainty about data residency requirements and potential jurisdictional issues.

encryption_standards.justification: Enterprise-grade encryption documented through SOC 2 Type 2 certification. Documentation explicitly states that 'every measured meeting is encrypted with permissions on who can access what reports' and mentions use of 'appropriate encryption algorithms.' The SOC 2 certification provides third-party verification of encryption standards.

data_retention.justification: Clear limited retention with comprehensive user control. Documentation provides detailed deletion capabilities including immediate account deletion, selective deletion of audio/video/data/reports, and participant-level opt-out with immediate data deletion. Users maintain full control over retention periods.

model_training.justification: Opt-out available with clear process and default opt-out policy. Documentation explicitly states 'Contributing to our model is completely optional, and opt-out by default' and 'the default is to opt-out, but users have a choice to opt-in.' This represents best practice for AI training data usage with clear user consent mechanisms.

data_sharing.justification: No third-party sharing with explicit policy statements. Documentation clearly states 'we don't sell your data to anyone - period' and 'Your data is kept private and only used to provide the service to you.' No indication of any third-party data sharing arrangements.

admin_management.justification: Limited controls for free tier with individual account focus. While Enterprise+ plan offers additional security features, the free version appears to operate primarily on individual account basis with minimal organizational visibility. Users can control meeting access but lack comprehensive admin dashboard for organizational oversight.

audit_capabilities.justification: Basic auditing with meeting tracking and permission controls. Users can see who invited Read to meetings and control report sharing permissions. However, comprehensive audit logs, exportable reports, and detailed user activity tracking are not clearly documented for the free tier.

integration.justification: Limited integration with SSO support but minimal enterprise features. Supports authentication via Microsoft and Google SSO, plus calendar integration for meeting scheduling. However, lacks comprehensive enterprise identity management features like SCIM provisioning and advanced API access for organizational management.

regulatory_violations.justification: Mostly compliant with strong certification foundation. Maintains SOC 2 Type 2 certification and offers HIPAA compliance with Business Associates Agreement availability. Documentation indicates professional compliance approach with third-party verification, though some specialized industry certifications may not be available.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Opaque processing for detailed technical specifications. While general data processing is clearly described and retention policies are transparent, specific data flow diagrams, detailed processing location information, and comprehensive third-party processor lists require contacting support rather than being publicly available.

documentation_and_support.justification: Adequate documentation with clear privacy policy and security information. SOC 2 Type 2 certification available upon request, responsive support email provided, and clear policy documentation. However, some security details require contacting support rather than being publicly available, and response times are not specified.
